Housed in the Louvre Museum, Paris Perhaps the most famous portrait in the world, Leonardo da Vinci’s Mona Lisa captivates viewers with her enigmatic smile and subtle expression. Painted during the Italian Renaissance, the work showcases Leonardo’s mastery of sfumato — a technique that softens transitions between colors and tones, giving the sitter a lifelike, almost breathing presence. The sitter, believed to be Lisa Gherardini, gazes out with a calm confidence that has intrigued scholars and admirers for centuries
